item.title: Robert add a quote by Andy Rooney
item.description: "Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it." -- Andy Rooney

item.title: Robert add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "Believe it is possible to solve your problem. Tremendous things happen to the believer. So believe the answer will come. It will." -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Robert add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "When you get up in the morning, you have two choices - either to be happy or to be unhappy. Just choose to be happy" -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Robert add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism" -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "When you're screwing up and nobody says anything to you anymore, that means they've given up on you." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "A lot of people want a shortcut. I find the best shortcut is the long way, which is basically two words: work hard." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "It's not how hard you hit. It's how hard you get hit...and keep moving forward." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Its important to have specific dreams. Dream Big. Dream without fear." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "When we're connected to others, we become better people." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Complaining does not work as a strategy. We all have finite time and energy. Any time we spend whining is unlikely to help us achieve our goals. And it won't make us happier." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Give yourself permission to dream. Fuel your kids' dreams too. Once in a while, that might even mean letting them stay up past their bedtimes." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description:
"No job is beneath you.
You ought to be thrilled you got a job in the mailroom And when you get there, here's what you do: Be really great at sorting mail. " -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The person who failed often knows how to avoid future failures. The person who knows only success can be more oblivious to all the pitfalls." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "I'm sorry. It's my fault. How do I make it right?" -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description:
"Randy Pausch on time management: Here's what I know: Time must be explicitly managed, like money. You can always change your plan, but only if you have one. Ask yourself: Are you spending your time on the right things? Develop a good filing system. Rethink the telephone. Delegate. Take a time out.
Time is all you have. And you may find one day that you have less than you think." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "There's a lot of talk these days about giving children self-esteem. It's not something you can give; it's something they have to build. Coach Graham worked in a no-coddling zone. Self-esteem? He knew there was really only one way to teach kids how to develop it: You give them something they can't do, they work hard until they find they can do it, and you just keep repeating the process." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "I know you're smart. But everyone here is smart. Smart isn't enough. The kind of people I want on my research team are those who will help everyone feel happy to be here. " -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "My coach knew there was only one way to develop (self esteem): You give children something they can't do, they work hard until they find they can do it, and you just keep repeating the process." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description:
"I was hugely impressed... was the ultimate example of a man who knew what he didn't know, was perfectly willing to admit it, and didn't want to leave until he understood. That's heroic to me.
I wish every grad student had that attitude." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Engineering isn't about perfect solutions; it's about doing the best you can with limited resources." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "No job should, be beneath us. And if you can't(or won't) sort mail, Where is the proof that you can do anything?" -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Your critics are the ones telling you they still love you and care. Worry when you do something badly and nobody bothers to tell you." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "And even though I did not reach the NFL, I sometimes think I got more from persuing that dream, and not accomplishing it, then I did from many of the ones I did accomplish." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "brick walls are there for a reason. They’re not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Robert add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "educators best serve students by helping them be more self-reflective. The only way any of us can improve—as Coach Graham taught me—is if we develop a real ability to assess ourselves. If we can’t accurately do that, how can we tell if we’re getting better or worse?" -- Randy Pausch
